website_summaries.verdict: For cases where space is tight, this liquid cooler provides plenty of power while keeping a  slim profile.
pros: Gain up to 40% in cooling performance over CPU box coolers with this enhanced design
The 25-millimeter thick radiator provides ample cooling surface area while maintaining a low-profile for cases where space is at a premium
cons: At higher speeds, the fan tends to rattle and can be quite noisy at times

customer_reviews.title: It worked like a champ, for a year.
customer_reviews.text: Received today, installed in about 20 minutes total. Came with am3+ adapter, so no waiting (I was worried it might not come with it). It is so quiet I can't hear it. My temps go up to 29°C playing Fallout 4, thats a huge improvement from going up to 86°C with a fan and heatsink. If it keeps this up, I'm going to be extremely satisfied. Well it lasted literally one year from the day I ordered it. It crapped out yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: Darthdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement cpu cooler......so happy I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Super easy install. Removed 1 star for instructions in Chinese only. Easy instal pretty self explanatory. But proof is in the pudding. I have an old Intel I5 2500k running at 4.3ghz and this thing is keeping it around low to mid 30s Celsius when idol. Never hotter than 45 degrees Celsius. The fan actually is not that bad either. The radiator core is made almost identical to my old Antek kuhler, which is made very sturdy. Fix the instructions and I will change my rating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: MoneyMaynard

customer_reviews.title: Great budget cooler!!
customer_reviews.text: Best Buy for the price . Got it to cool an FX 8350 ,and it Brought temps down 15 degrees compared to stock cooler. Installation is extremely easy. Instructions could be better. Included fan is very bright,and air flow exceeded my expectations. Pump unit is almost silent. Overall a great low cost cooling solution ,that I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular deal, just as good if not better than big name brand All in ones.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal cooling for my overclocked Ryzen 7. Currently using it in a folding@home setup for seti and have it setup in a 4u rack mount cage with 4 1070ti video cards. It has a very small footprint and keeps my processor around 55-60c @ full load and overclocked. Quality is really nice. Its also very quiet and includes a good fan. Don't care for the light on the fan, so I just cut the LED's. However if you like the red lighted transparent fan than you're certainly in luck!
customer_reviews.author: John Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooler for a budget build
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooler for a budget build, or any build really. Super quiet, and so easy to build I didn't even look at the instructions. Seems durable. As good or better than large name brand systems.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: spent all day taking my custom computer apart. this ...
customer_reviews.text: spent all day taking my custom computer apart. this will not fit my am3b mobo. no matter how you turn the water block
customer_reviews.author: M. B. Young

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad!
customer_reviews.text: Product works how it should. I idle around 35c and with load around 50-56c. The fan is not very noisy at all compared to a stock cooler. Only negative thing i can find is the instructions you pretty much need to know what your doing to install this thing. The instructions do not include any writing information simply a few hard to understand pictures. I seen alot of reviews saying it does not come with the AMD bracket mine did. Overall a decent cooler for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: There aren't very many options for AIO with red LED, but this thing has been awesome so far. Had it awhile now and it still cools my 8350 like a champ. Pumps are a little loud, but I like hearing it kick on. Lets you know it's working.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the AMD Bracket, it was easy to install, looks great, very quite! (Note: AMD Heatsink bracket was missing) The price was right! Don't regret purchasing product. Would recommend to friends, family, everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Blaise M Nakagawa Jr

customer_reviews.title: This is a very aforable and very good quality CPU cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is a very aforable and very good quality CPU cooler, I had doubts but after reading some of the comments I have baught this cooler and it works perfectly no noise keeps my CPU at very low temperature, the silence of it is deafening. Great cooler, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: keron

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but good
customer_reviews.text: While it works better than I was expecting for such a inexpensive AIO water cooler the instructions were next to useless and had to figure it out myself. The only other complaint I have is the mounting bracket is a hard plastic instead of metal and made removing the cooler to redo the thermal compound difficult because the screw came loose and scraped away the plastic holding the screw.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Drennan

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time trying a water cooling system in my computer. Worked like a charm. Keeps my system 20° C cooler. I love it! Using with a tower too small for adequate air flow. AMD X4 870k processor. I render and upload videos to YouTube. I would get up to 95 ° C during rendering but with this I never go above 72° C.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality for the price. No leaks, and runs fairly quiet. Fan does a good job of moving air through the radiator, so you generally see a 10-20 C drop in temperatures Vs. an air cooler. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Price Point
customer_reviews.text: This cooler replaced a 6 year old Corsair H60, which had all it's fluid evaporated. Yes, it was a closed loop All In One so these things can go dry, and after 6 years I guess it was about time.The installation was not all that difficult, but it was "troublesome". These directions nowadays are for the "Age Of Garanimals".... pictures for everything..... but the graphics could had been a bit more "hi-res". I am using this with an older andy Bridge Core i5, slightly over clocked to 4 GHz, and things run smooth, and stable.
customer_reviews.author: L. Darthard

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for the price
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and install was easy however the instructions suck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with a thin layer of thermal paste and a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great with a thin layer of thermal paste and a push pull system to get the radiator cooled.
customer_reviews.author: henry

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome radiator plus fan! CPU temp doesn’t go higher then 60 degrees at full load
customer_reviews.author: alarn

customer_reviews.title: I have ordered this item twice and it has come ...
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this item twice and it has come missing the AMD mounting bracket both times. I suggest that if you are planning to use on an AMD unit NOT to order this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome affordable cooler.
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for the money. I'm stoaked to put in my build. My one critique is the installation instructions are only pictures, and it's difficult to tell where the instructions for an intel chip stop and an AMD begin.
customer_reviews.author: Matt the Blacksmith

customer_reviews.title: Crap, crap, crap
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this purchase. I ordered it 3- 14- 17. After it had shipped I received an email from the manufacturer tell me that, said product was missing the bracket for AMD cpu. When I received the part on 3- 17- 17. Sure enough it's missing. I responded to the email as they requested. It's now 3- 26- 17, and still don't have the part. Which has cost me the build contract on this computer. And a lose of profit of 300.00 us dollar.
customer_reviews.author: RageQuit Gaming

customer_reviews.title: Pump is fine. . . . Fan not so much
customer_reviews.text: The pump work great but the fan seems to be cheaply made and makes noise when i start the PC up. I have to open the case and stop the fan with a finger and let it start again and the noise is gone
customer_reviews.author: Armando Marrero

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest manual, a little web search helped with that
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest manual, a little web search helped with that. I have AMD, and the bracket was included, plus 1 star. So far so good, temperatures remain steady, even with over-clocked AMD CPU also Nvidia 1060, running 1920x1080 Overwatch games. The install is a bit complicated if you've never done one before, experienced hardware builders should have no problem...
customer_reviews.author: John C. Endieveri

product_meta.title: upHere Technology All-in-One High Performance Liquid CPU Cooler with Adjustable 120mm PWM Fan,Red LED
product_meta.description:
upHere Water Cooling System CPU Cooler
From stock to overclock, This product fit the needs for CPU cooling performance with minimal maintenance for an all-in-one solution. With a large full copper base plate, universal socket compatibility and extra large 154mm aluminum radiator, gain up to 40% in cooling performance over CPU box coolers. Experience extreme cooling performance and low noise to protect your most vital component from heat.

Copper microfin cold plate
The cold plate draws heat from your CPU into the circulating liquid. Copper has outstanding thermal conductivity, and the microfin design provides fast and efficient heat transfer.

25mm x 120mm radiator
The 25mm thickness combines ample cooling surface area with a low-profile size that’s ideal for smaller cases or any installation where space is at a premium

Radiator Material : Aluminum
Fan Speed: 800-1800 RPM (+/- 10%)
Radiator dimensions: 120mm x 152mm x 27mm, 
Fan dimensions: 120mm x 120mm x 25mm

What's Included
1x 120M Liquid CPU Watercooling Kit
1x Universal Mounting Kit
1x Led Fan
1x Thermal Paste Syringe
feature_bullets: Pre-filled with coolant at the factory then sealed and pressure tested, 25mm thick radiator core for enhanced compatibility with small cases.

High-torque 120mm PWM fan，You can connect them to the standard PWM fan headers on your motherboard for precise fan speed control, and select the exact level of cooling performance you need and adjustable noise levels.
Optimized pump and water block guarantees the best water flow and system cooling performance
Specially designed 120mm radiator provides superior heat dissipation performance and fits in virtually any computer case internally or externally
Compatible CPU Sockets - Intel LGA 2011, 1366, 1156, 1155, 1150, 775 and AMD FM1, FM2, AM3+, AM3, AM2+, AM2

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars32 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
